Last meal in Barcelona. 5 stars for the udon that is made on the premise,  which actually tastes good.  We watched the chef handle the raw dough.   Order some appetizers because it's going to take a minute for the dough to be rolled out (machine).  The regular gyoza is solid.  Had the curry udon and the udon with kakiage (tempura shredded vegetables and shrimp).The only thing that could have improved my night was if there was just a dish of tempura  shrimp. Trip advisor bought me here.  Sometimes it lies but this time it made me happy.
